title: Is it important to learn C++ after C language? Which language should I learn after C language? - Quora

response.answer_text: It’s not absolutely necessary. But it is a logical step and I would recommend it. When you learn C++, you’ll know Object Oriented Programming very well. And the OOP paradigm is probably the most used programming approach there is. It’ll be easy for you to understand and learn any other OO programming language in existence after C++. Last but not least, C++ is a very good language. But beware; C is a simple language, you can learn it relatively quickly. C++ is much more complex; properly learning it and gaining experience is much harder and takes years. If you’re looking for something you’ll learn more easily (namely for OOP), languages like Python or perhaps Java might be a better choice.
